There's an oddity about KSP wings in that they do not generate lift at zero angle of attack. You can help yourself a great deal by adjusting the landing gear so that the nose is a little higher than the tail while the plane is on the runway. That way, the wings are already at a slight angle to the airflow and will start to generate lift as you roll down the runway.
Or one step further than Vanmodes suggestion,  and rotate the wings 5 degrees relative to the fuselage,  this also helps reduce body drag once you're airborne.
Or, when all else fails, wait till the end of the runway.
